column4: What's the best approach for trouble-shooting total lock ups in Ubuntu 6.06?

dmesg may be a good start, then grep through all of /var/log.  also, i suggest that when it locks you, you try pressing SysRq (which is usually AltGr+SysRq, really) together with the following keys, in sequence: R S E I U B
that will hopefully reboot the system more cleanly than if you just pressed the Reset switch, avoiding filesystem corruptions and giving the system more chances to actually *write* stuff to the logs
